intro: Ainsliaea angustifolia var. luchunensis, commonly known as the Luchun narrowleaf ainsliaea, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, which attract various pollinators. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests or rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
